raw_text:
UK Athletics agrees new kit deal
 
 UK Athletics has agreed a new deal with adidas to supply Great Britain squads of all ages with their kit for the next four years.
 
 The German-based firm kitted out Team GB at the 2004 Olympics and has deals with 20 other national Olympic bodies. UK Athletics chief David Moorcroft said: "The Athens experience can now be extended to more major championships. "In the year ahead these include the European indoor and World outdoor championships. We are delighted." Moorcroft added: "It is hugely beneficial to the sport that the adidas commitment will also provide for officials and other personnel at our world-class series of live televised events." This week, UK Athletics also agreed a four-year deal with energy drink company, Red Bull, who will be supplying the product to athletics at major domestic meetings and in high performance centres.

UK Athletics chief David Moorcroft also agrees four-year deal with Red Bull.

Additionally, UK Athletics signed a separate four-year partnership with Red Bull to supply energy drinks at major domestic events and high performance centers.

opencoder:1.5b:
UK Athletics agrees on a new kit deal for the next four years.

The German firm has agreed to supply athletes of all ages from Great Britain with their new kit, including the 2004 Olympics. UK Athletics chief David Moorcroft said: "The athlete experience can now be extended to more major championships. These include the European indoor and World outdoor Championships. We are very happy to share." Moorcroft added: "It is beneficial for the sport that the adidas commitment will also provide for our world-class live televised events at our meetings and in high performance centres."

The UK Athletics has agreed a four-year agreement with adidas to supply their UK squads with kits for major competitions. The deal includes Team GB from the Olympics and partnerships with 20 other nations. It supports major events like the European indoor and World outdoor championships, benefiting officials during live televised shows. Red Bull will also supply energy drinks to major meetings and high performance centers in these areas.
tinyllama:1.1b: UK Athletics signs new kit deal with adidas for all ages and has agreements with 20 other national Olympic bodies to provide Great Britain squads with kiT throughout the next four years, including hosting World Indoor & Outdoor Championships. The contract is also extended to include officials and live-streamed events at major athletics meets, such as the European Indoor and World Outdoor Championship. The deal further solidifies UK Athletics' position in the market for high-quality sportswear, and represents a significant investment in athlete welfare by the governing body.
tinydolphin:1.1b: In summary, UK Athletics has signed a new kit deal with adidas, allowing them to provide their Great Britain squads with kit for the next four years. The agreement extends their existing partnership with adidas from the London 2012 Olympics to major championships in European indoor and World outdoor Championships in 2014-15. This decision marks a significant expansion of coverage, enabling more athletes from all age groups to participate at elite level events. UK Athletics Chief David Moorcroft expressed his delight at securing this new deal and looking forward to the future opportunities for growth in both sports.
